text.text_translated:
In the last 200 years, technology and health got better.
This meant fewer children died young, so the number of people grew very fast.
Families were very large.
Their children also survived and had more children.
But in the 1960s, contraception became easier to get.
Contraception is a medicine or a thing. It stops a woman from having a baby.
Because of this, the average number of babies for one woman in the world went down from six to about two.
